subject: Design
title: The Sony Walkman: Music Goes Personal
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Sony Walkman: Music Goes Personal.

hook.text: Sony's engineers said no one would buy a tape player that couldn't record. Akio Morita ignored them.

buildup.text: Akio Morita overruled them. In 1979, the TPS-L2 Walkman launched â€” a tiny cassette player with headphones.

discovery.text: It created an entirely new behavior: people listening to personal music while walking, running, and commuting.

twist.text: Critics said nobody would buy a tape player that couldn't record. Sony sold 200 million Walkmans.

climax.text: The Walkman proved that removing features can be the ultimate design innovation.

punchline.text: The device that changed music forever couldn't record a single note.

quiz.question: What feature did the Walkman famously lack?
